title: Question:
author: bisdak40
created_time: May 24, 2022, 09:34:36 PMLast edit: July 24, 2022, 09:46:58 AM by bisdak40
content: cttoIt's officially announced that the trilogy between Canelo and GGG will happen this September 17 and the rematch with Bivol will wait or will not happen. For me, this should happen years ago when GGG was not so old hehe but nevertheless fans will still watch this fight to see if GGG has still some tricks on his sleeve.Who you've got on this fight?QuoteCanelo vs Golovkin 3: Trilogy match between Canelo Alvarez and Gennadiy Golovkin officially announced for September 17https://www.badlefthook.com/2022/5/24/23139765/canelo-alvarez-vs-gennadiy-golovkin-trilogy-match-announced-for-september-17-boxing-news-2022

comments.author: Quidat
comments.body: People would really be still loving to see this Trilogy which lots had been anticipating for too long and now it would really happen. THanks for the share up bud.I do agree that it should really be done few years back where GGG isnt really still near on his retirement or simply being old but for sure he do still have something into his sleeves.But i would really be still considering for Canelo on closing this one for good.

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: At the age of 31, Canelo looks to be nearing retirement. He appeared to have lost his motivation, or been in too many wars against Bivol. What sucks for GGG is he has only 1 loss on his record to Canelo. And many felt GGG won both fights. A case could be made for GGG being undefeated at this point in his carer.GGG might have to knock Canelo out to get a win. Removing the judges from the equation is the only chance he has of winning. Commentators and judges are too biased in Canelo's favor.Canelo to me is the most overrated boxer in the world. I don't understand how he gets so much hype behind him.

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: Quote from: Quidat on May 24, 2022, 09:59:49 PMPeople would really be still loving to see this Trilogy which lots had been anticipating for too long and now it would really happen. THanks for the share up bud.I do agree that it should really be done few years back where GGG isnt really still near on his retirement or simply being old but for sure he do still have something into his sleeves.But i would really be still considering for Canelo on closing this one for good.Â  The consolation here is that GGG is still very much active as he just won over Murata.So the preparation won't be that too hard for him because he is still active. If in case Canelo will lose this fight, what do you think will be next for him?Will GGG retire for good or arrange for another big fight? But who?My prediction here is that GGG may be slightly favored by sportsbooks when it comes to odds.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: It was a smart move for his team to avoid an early trilogy simce an older GGG is less of a threat to him. I honestly thought this would never happen but here we are...It will be Canelo by KO or Unanimous Decision. GGG couldn't knock out Canelo in the previous fights and I doubt he has the power to do it now or the speed to win by decision.

comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on May 24, 2022, 10:12:31 PMAt the age of 31, Canelo looks to be nearing retirement. He appeared to have lost his motivation, or been in too many wars against Bivol. I don't understand with you mate, Canelo do lost from Bivol... but he lost because he is moving his weight and straightly fight with a champion. He need to familiarize in his new weight first and fight with weak boxer, perhaps Canelo don't want it since it looks like like he's cherry pick his opponent. The first fight against GGG are pretty close, but the second isn't, that's why Canelo win it. Seems many people only focus about Canelo lost and forgot how much his win streaks so far.

comments.author: agustina2
comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on May 24, 2022, 10:12:31 PMAt the age of 31, Canelo looks to be nearing retirement. He appeared to have lost his motivation, or been in too many wars against Bivol. At the age of 31 Canelo is considered still in heavily prime. That was the impression prior to fighting Bivol and no one even thinks that he won't lose at the moment of his career. But even if he loses on that, that won't change that he's still in his prime. Regarding the now officially trilogy between GGG and Canelo, it should happen early as the former is now almost in the retiring period. But since GGG showed dominance against Murata previously, I hope GGG will put Canelo on his 2nd consecutive loss.The time now to end the chapter of these 2 greats. GGG will retire happily if he won this match.

comments.author: chaser15
comments.body: Awesome. The anticipated and one of the awaiting fights of the year will now happen. They arranged the fight right away since they need to market it heavily because the previous loss that happened in Canelo plays a big role here. GGG however, won the requirements of this fight. I thought no GGG fight if Canelo will lose but still, organizers don't want to waste the opportunity as this fight is expected to be a million money worth, and PPV sales are expected to be sold out as early as months to go before the official fight.I'm looking forward to GGG winning the fight because Canelo still has many chances to redeem himself if ever he will lose here. Lots of time to still get his achievements compared to GGG which I think win or loss on this trilogy, he will now hang his gloves for good.GGG for me is the winner of their rematch but can't say the same thing about their first match. In this trilogy, we will now find out who's the best. If only this happens during the good years, we won't include GGG's age as the factor why he will not win against Canelo.

comments.author: lienfaye
comments.body: Many fans are waiting for this trilogy and now its going to happen even it takes too long.The last fight of Canelo didnt turn out well for him so this is the chance for GGG to redeem himself.Well actually he already redeem himself as a great boxer for winning his previous fights after his loss to Canelo. Though its a bit different now to face Canelo because of GGG's age.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Finally! But better late than never is not applicable in boxing. With age comes deterioration in one's speed, power, and overall boxing skills. I just hope GGG at 40 could still pull off some great shots. He's a great boxer but age matters, at least in boxing. As a matter of fact, while he had a TKO win over the inactive Murata in his last fight, I observed he has indeed slowed down a bit. On the other hand, it is a bit unfair that he's only being given the chance after Canelo lost to Bivol. It takes a loss for Canelo to accommodate this trilogy when this should have been done much much earlier. I'd be praying and cheering for GGG but I won't be making a bet.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: Darker45 on May 25, 2022, 01:53:01 AMI'd be praying and cheering for GGG but I won't be making a bet. I'll also do that I believe in Canelo but will not make a bet, this is a dangerous fight for Canelo and there's a risk in investing in Canelo, many lose their bet in the Canelo -Â  Bivol fight and there's a possibility that it could happen here again, Golovkin will study Canelo's match against Bivol and he will try to do better than Bivol, he can do better because he is an experienced boxer and tested Canelo's power already.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: At least Canelo making the good decision of giving us fans the needed trilogy instead of fighting Bivol again.And this will be a career defining moment for him, I guess the lost to Bivol will give him motivation to finished off the storybook story between him and Canelo. Not sure if the odds are out yet, I haven't check but Canelo will be the favorite here despite his recent L.

comments.author: TravelMug

comments.body: GGG and Canelo is tailor made against each other, and this will be another close match. Although GGG is almost 40 years old, he will want to avenge his only lost in boxing. So for me, he is the more motivated and hungrier boxer in this fight. And for boxer bettors, this is a good opportunity if he is going to be the underdog here. So I might go with GGG just because I'm a big fan of him and wanted to see him win.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Quote from: Kemarit on May 25, 2022, 02:28:23 AMAt least Canelo making the good decision of giving us fans the needed trilogy instead of fighting Bivol again.A good decision but not because of the fans. It was because if he will fight Bivol again, he might finally end up losing again. Haven't you noticed how silent Canelo is after he loses? If he really thinks he can go a win against Bivol in a rematch, he will surely be vocal about it. There's hesitation because he knows to himself he can't handle the underdog Bivol for the 2nd time. Instead, he chooses to fight against the older GGG and stick with the supposed original plan if he wins against Bivol. He thinks he can handle easily that old guy plus awaiting big money that will be generated by this match instead of fighting Bivol in a rematch.
